entities.description: Criteria to exclude respondents younger than age 12 from the survey.
Criteria to exclude respondents engaged in active duty in the U.S. military.
Initial set of questions including birth date, gender, and state of residence.
Process where interviews may be terminated due to ineligibility or incomplete responses.
System of checks within the CAI program to reduce inconsistent data from respondents.
Process to identify and address inconsistent data or replace missing data with non-missing values.
System in the CAI program that reduces opportunities for respondents to give inconsistent answers by skipping non-applicable questions.
Variables pertained to the use of substances like nicotine, alcohol, marijuana, cocaine, heroin, hallucinogens, inhalants, and methamphetamine.
Questions designed to determine if respondents had ever used specific substances.

relationships.description: Survey termination condition if the respondent is younger than 12.
Survey termination condition if the respondent is on active duty in the U.S. military.
Initial questions in the survey targeting demographic information.
Initial screening may lead to termination if age eligibility is not met.
Initial screening may lead to termination if military status is active duty.
CAI program’s process to ensure data consistency.
Data processing step to address inconsistent or missing data.
CAI system utilizes routing logic to prevent inconsistent responses.
Survey includes variables related to substance use.
Questions designed to determine substance use history of the respondents.
